hook.text: An adopted child pushes away the parents who chose him. It looks like rejection. It's actually fear.

buildup.text: Children adopted after early deprivation often test new caregivers relentlessly.

discovery.text: The testing is an unconscious question: 'Will you stay even when I'm at my worst?'

twist.text: Earlier adoption produces better attachment outcomes. After age two, forming bonds takes longer.

climax.text: With patience and consistency, most adopted children can form secure attachments â€” it just takes more time.

quiz.question: Why do adopted children often 'test' their new caregivers?
options: To see if the caregiver will stay despite difficult behavior
Because they dislike the new family
